I. Paternal inheritance – As mentioned earlier, this refers to the maternal effect where the mother passes an allele to the offspring. Since the variegated and pale shades appear to be paternal, I is incorrect.

J. Multifactorial inheritance – This implies that multiple factors (like genes, environment, etc.) interact to produce the phenotype. Given that the traits are influenced by the branch source, which combines elements of both genes and environment, multifactorial inheritance fits better.
